meanings.definition: To solidify or thicken by cooling or freezing.
meanings.sent1: The soup will conge when left in the refrigerator.
meanings.sent2: I watched the chocolate conge as it cooled on the counter.
meanings.sent3: The jelly started to conge into a wobbly mass.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to conge with fear as she heard the noise.
meanings.sent5: The lava congealed into a hard rock formation.

meanings.sent1: The conge on top of the stew looked unappetizing.
meanings.sent2: She scraped off the conge from the bottom of the pan.
meanings.sent3: The conge on the windshield made it hard to see.
meanings.sent4: The conge of ice on the pond was perfect for skating.
meanings.sent5: The conge of blood on the wound indicated a serious injury.

meanings.sent1: His muscles began to conge after sitting for too long.
meanings.sent2: The fabric will conge if not properly stretched after washing.
meanings.sent3: The old glue started to conge in the bottle.
meanings.sent4: The fear made her thoughts conge into a jumbled mess.
meanings.sent5: The cold weather caused the river to conge into ice.
